componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Real Estate Crowdfunding Opportunities in Australia

componentInstanceProperties.name: summaryText
componentInstanceProperties.value: We give our crowd access to impactful property investments that allow you to diversify your portfolio.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Diversify Your Portfolio Today with Property Crowdfunding Investment!


Property investing is now accessible to all.

  • Invest in high-quality real estate with low upfront cost.
  • We’ve delivered over $20 million in returns to investors.
  • Maximise your portfolio returns and diversify your risk

In a time of high inflation and interest rates, combined with high rents and very low rental vacancies, it is harder than ever for many Australians to break into the property market. What many people don’t know is there are alternative ways to invest in property without buying a house.

Property crowdfunding offers real estate investors another doorway through to the world of property investing. It also opens that door wider so that more people can invest in real estate projects that inspire them.

Learn how you can start earning passive income with property crowdfunding


Book a call

componentInstanceProperties.name: DescriptionText1
componentInstanceProperties.value:

Invest in Preference Equity targeting 12% p.a paid monthly in arrears

componentInstanceProperties.name: DescriptionText4

Carrara is one of the highest growth suburbs in Australia, with 37.4% capital growth last year. This property fund enables wholesale and pre-approved investors to earn passive income and receive monthly distributions, investing in preference shares in an architecturally designed project in Carrara, QLD.

Earn 12% p.a. paid monthly or compound for 24 months

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Why Property Crowdfunding?


"Property’s the great Australian dream, and property development is something that should be open to everybody. Traditionally, it hasn’t been because it requires high levels of initial investment. Crowdfunding allows small investors to invest more easily in property and property development like they can in shares. VentureCrowd is a first mover in this space, in terms of Property development and crowdfunding."

– David Whitting, Property Director at VentureCrowd

Learn more about how property crowdfunding works

Watch: Diversifying your portfolio with property crowdfunding

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Context
componentInstanceProperties.value:
With property crowdfunding, you have numerous investors contributing small amounts to purchase property or property-development projects. This is facilitated by a crowdfunding platform, like VentureCrowd, which vets the investment and development projects and brings the investors together.

Traditional property investment requires a considerable amount of capital. Pooling funds from numerous investors makes property investment far more affordable. Investors might be able to enter the property market with as little as $100 or $1,000 depending on the platform.

Investors might receive their share of rental returns if the property is leased and then again receive returns associated with any growth in capital when the property is sold. If it’s a property-development project, the investor may receive their return when the property is fully developed and sold. These are examples of property equity investments. In the case of a crowdfunded property-backed loan investment, your returns will be in the form of interest on the funds you lend/invest.

VentureCrowd is committed to the democratisation of property investment. We offer wholesale property crowdfunding opportunities for investors and developers, and soon to be retail opportunities too. Find out more about our property fund opportunities here.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Context
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Capital growth and rental yields should be the focus when it comes to investing in property. These can depend on factors like location, property features, local amenities, demand versus supply, and type of property. For generating a steady income, look at vacancy rates, types of in-demand properties, and the median and average rental yields for the area.

For the prospects of capital growth, research growth-trend indicators for the property, such as median sale prices, demographic data, schools, and amenities. Also consider costs such as mortgage repayments (if you’re investing in the traditional way), strata fees, council fees, insurance, and maintenance costs.

By investing through VentureCrowd’s platform, you’ll save yourself from having to do exhaustive research and vetting. Our property experts conduct in-depth research and hand-select all property deals. We can assist you as we work to a professional crowdfunding model aimed at reducing complexity. We guide you through access to handpicked investment opportunities in alternative assets and investment properties. Understanding the basics of property investing is important so you know how it works and if this is right for you.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What to look for in an investment property?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What to look for in an investment property?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Context
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Successful property investing takes into account a wide range of factors beyond location. What makes a good investment for one person might not be the same for the next person. You’ll want to start by considering your investment goals, such as whether you’re looking for a steady income, capital growth, or both. Take a look at the bigger picture - that is, the big trends. These include population growth, supply and demand, local infrastructure, liveability, vacancy rates, and amenities.

Population growth means local properties are likely to be popular with both buyers (capital growth) and tenants (rental returns). Stay up to date with any infrastructure and amenities developments in the local area, as these could raise livability. Also, look for properties with desirable features for buyers and tenants. It’s also important to do your research so you’re buying into areas or investing in developments with strong growth potential.

The Queensland property market is an excellent place to start, and with VentureCrowd, you can take advantage of our promising investment opportunities. Get in touch with our team today to discuss how you can diversify your portfolio with property investing.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: Where to buy an investment property?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: Where to buy an investment property?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Context
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Crowdfunding for real estate investments has existed in a similar form for centuries, through collective real estate investing where you pool money with others to buy property. However, crowdfunding brings the ability to transact online and gives investors unparalleled access to deal flow through the internet.

You can look for investments online, sign paperwork to buy into properties and development projects, transfer funds, and monitor how investments are going. If you choose a reputable platform like VentureCrowd, you’ll have access to vetted investments rather than having to do time-consuming due diligence on investment options.

There are usually three parties involved: the sponsor, the platform, and the investor. The sponsor is the person or company who oversees the investment, buys the property, manages the property and/or development, and arranges for the eventual sale. The crowdfunding platform is where sponsors and investors are brought together to raise capital. The platform evaluates projects and sponsors, ensures investors and deals meet requirements, and checks for compliance and regulatory issues. The investor is the party who contributes funds and receives income and/or a profit when the property is sold profitably.

At VentureCrowd, we offer a unique approach to property crowdfunding whereby our property team is made up of developers and end-to-end property managers to oversee the development of a project. This enables us to manage the quality and feasibility of a project, from the selection of land development all the way through to the construction and eventual sale of the property. Find out more about property crowdfunding here.
